p: The date of the most recent common ancestor (tMRCA) of the Rio Janeiro clade was estimated to June 2015 (95% Bayesian credible interval: May to July 2015) ( Fig 1). This estimation suggests the ECSA lineage circulated unnoticed for approximately 5 months before the first reports of CHIKV autochthonous transmissions in Rio de Janeiro, in November 2015 [ 23, 24].
